Job Title: Senior Safety Coordinator

Location: Dallas, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Who We Are

We're The Beck Group, the largest and most innovative integrated building firm in the country. We are focused on delivering design and construction excellence on a broad range of project types. Headquartered in downtown Dallas, with offices in Atlanta, Austin, Charlotte, Denver, Fort Lauderdale, Fort Worth, Mexico City, and Tampa, we believe a better process and outcome results from working together. At Beck, you will find yourself surrounded by passionate colleagues who have a collaborative mindset and care about each other. We are committed to hiring the best and brightest within our industry, and that's why we are seeking experienced professionals like you to help transform the industry and continue building Beck's respected reputation.

As a Senior Safety Coordinator, you will play a key role in ensuring the highest level of safety standards and practices across our construction projects. You will lead a project team and collaborate closely with project staff, and subcontractor representatives, to develop and implement effective safety programs and protocols. Your expertise in safety regulations, incident investigation, training, and risk management will be instrumental in maintaining a safe and secure work environment to develop a positive safety culture.

Responsibilities

Lead and oversee a project, providing guidance, mentorship, and support in their daily activities.Attend initial meetings with project staff and subcontractor representatives to define their roles within the project regarding safety.Conduct and document pre-planning safety meetings with subcontractor safety representatives and foremen to establish Beck’s Zero Accident Plan.Establish and conduct regular (weekly) safety meetings with subcontractor representatives to promote ongoing safety awareness and compliance.Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal safety regulations applicable to the construction industry.Help enforce Beck’s Drug and Alcohol Policy, including handling site drug testing.Implement and maintain comprehensive safety programs across multiple projects, ensuring alignment with company standards and best practices.Conduct thorough investigations and analysis of incidents, accidents, and near-misses, determining root causes and contributing factors. Generate detailed reports with recommendations for corrective actions.Collaborate with project staff and subcontractors to conduct formal weekly jobsite inspections, documenting safety violations, and implementing corrective measures.Deliver effective safety training sessions to employees at all levels, promoting a proactive safety culture.Develop and deliver safety orientation programs for new employees and trade partners to ensure a comprehensive understanding of safety protocols.Assist in reviewing subcontractor safety training documentation, verifying compliance with company standards, and providing guidance as needed.Maintain organized and up-to-date safety documentation, including incident reports, inspection records, and training records.Proactively identify opportunities for improving safety performance and implementing preventive measures.Stay updated on industry trends, regulations, and best practices, continuously enhancing your knowledge and skills in construction safety.Strong organizational skills with the ability to maintain and manage comprehensive safety documentation

Qualifications:

Minimum of 5 years of relevant construction safety experience, with a demonstrated progression in responsibility and leadership.Strong knowledge and understanding of local, state, and federal safety regulations, including OSHA standards (29 CFR 1926) for construction safety.OSHA 500College degree in a related field is desired, or equivalent combination of education and experience.Proficiency in using construction technologies and software, such as Excel, Synchro, Procore, Bluebeam, CMiC, and Revit, is a plus.

Physical Demands:

Frequently operates a computer and other office productivity equipment; frequently ascends/descends ladders and stairs; constantly works in various outdoor weather conditions; frequently moves equipment up to 50Ibs to various locations on site; constantly communicates with subcontractors, vendors, and other members of project team; ability to constantly move around job site on uneven surfaces; Spends much of the day standing. Ability to adhere to consistent and timely attendance.

Beck’s Benefits

At Beck our team member experience goes beyond your day-to-day work activities – we also want to support the rest of your life goals, milestones and challenges. We strive for thrive – we want you to thrive in your wellbeing, finances, and community.

In addition to robust coverage for medical, dental, vision, life & disability benefits, Beck is pleased to offer its team members:

401k match and free SmartDollar program for financial wellnessFree dedicated financial coachPersonal health & fitness program for tracking activities & earning rewardsPaid family leaveHealth discounts on medical premiumsFree comprehensive health screeningsFree health coach program for weight-loss & hypertension managementFinancial & behavioral support for family forming journeys (ex. Fertility, adoption, pregnancy, and parenthood).Free Life CoachPet insurance discountOrganized projects and events to support our communities

Join our team and build your future with Beck.

The Beck Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, or genetic information. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
